title: Rajasthan Lok Nritya – Advanced Exam Trivia

questions.text: Which Lok Nritya is historically linked with the worship rituals of Baba Ramdev and involves male performers playing a five-string instrument while dancing?
questions.explanation: Ramdev Nritya (also called Ramdevji ka Nritya) is traditionally performed with ‘Bhapang’ and is linked to the worship of Baba Ramdev.

questions.text: Chakri dance is mainly associated with which sub-community known historically for their wandering lifestyle and performance traditions in the Kota–Bundi belt?
questions.explanation: Chakri is performed by Kanjar women of Hadoti region, especially during Kajali Teej.

questions.text: Which dance's rhythmic pattern is traditionally based on the ‘Bhawai’ tala but incorporates balancing skills rooted in the Jat & Kumhar communities of Nagaur?
questions.explanation: Bhawai uses balancing skills (matkas, thalis) and has origins among Jat & Kumhar women of Nagaur.

questions.text: In which region is the *Danda Nritya* (also called ‘Dandia Raas of Desert’) performed specifically during the *Hinglaj Mata* ritual traditions?
questions.explanation: Godwad region preserves Danda Nritya linked with Hinglaj Mata rituals.

questions.text: Which of the following instruments is MOST essential in Chang Nritya and differentiates it from other Holi-related dances in Rajasthan?
questions.explanation: Chang Nritya uses the large frame drum 'Chang' which defines its tempo and style.

questions.text: Kalbelia dancers’ costumes evolved significantly during the 1980s–1990s due to which primary reason?
questions.explanation: Costumes were redesigned mainly to appeal to tourism and stage-show audiences.

questions.text: Which dance of Rajasthan traditionally uses ‘Tippla’ sticks and symbolizes a local mythological battle performed largely by Garasia tribes?
questions.explanation: Gair has many variants (Mewari, Dandia Gair, Jodhpuri Gair). Garasia tribes use long sticks called Tippla.

questions.text: Which nritya is uniquely associated with the Siddi (Habshi) community in Rajasthan?
questions.explanation: Dhamal is performed by the Siddi community, descendants of East African migrants.

questions.text: In Terahtaali Nritya, the manjiras tied on the body are traditionally how many?
questions.explanation: Terahtaali literally refers to 13 manjiras tied on various points of the body.

questions.text: Which dance includes the tradition of *Veer Gatha* narration, performed by men on wooden dummy horses representing the exploits of the Baagrawat community?
questions.explanation: Kachhi Ghodi narrates stories of Baagrawat warriors and bandits from Shekhawati.

questions.text: Which Lok Nritya has a rare variant known as ‘Dhol Gair’ and is especially popular in Ajmer district during Gangaur?
questions.explanation: Dhol Gair is a heavy percussion-based form seen in Ajmer/Godwad regions.

questions.text: Panihari songs and dances are historically connected with what traditional social structure of western Rajasthan?
options: Water scarcity & long-distance water fetching roles
questions.explanation: Panihari songs depict hardships of fetching water from far-off wells due to desert scarcity.

questions.text: Loor dance, mainly performed during Holi, is associated with which agrarian practice?
options: Pre-harvest fertility songs in Bharatpur–Karauli belt
questions.explanation: Loor of eastern Rajasthan celebrates fertility and crops before harvest.

questions.text: Which nritya involves acrobatic feats using swords and shields and is traditionally performed by the Rajput community?
questions.explanation: Talwar Raas is a martial-style dance involving swords.

questions.text: Which dance shows a fusion of Bhil ritualistic elements and Mewari cultural patterns, often performed during 'Bhagoria'-like fairs?
questions.explanation: Bhil Gair mixes tribal motifs with Mewar festive elements.

questions.text: Which Lok Nritya is performed by the *Sargara* community to honor local deities and includes symbolic plough movements?
questions.explanation: Dhol Nritya by Sargara community uses symbolic agricultural gestures.

questions.text: In Ghoomar, the step-pattern known as ‘Jhelna’ primarily represents:
options: A fertility ritual for newly married women
The movement of monsoon winds in Marwar
questions.explanation: Ghoomar is deeply connected with marital rites; ‘Jhelna’ symbolizes reproductive blessings.

questions.text: Which Rajasthani dance evolved from the oral tradition of 'Achara' customs among women and is performed in small domestic spaces?
questions.explanation: Mand dance is linked with women's Achara rituals and sung in 'Mand' raag.

questions.text: The dance where performers carry fire-lit brass pots (with cotton wicks soaked in oil) is historically linked to which region?
questions.explanation: Chari Nritya with fire pots is especially famous in Jodhpur and Barmer belts.

questions.text: Which Rajasthan dance features rope-walking, balancing acts, and clown elements resembling early Indian circus traditions?
questions.explanation: Nat/Tamasha Nritya includes rope-walking and acrobatics performed by Nat community.
